alert.note: Alert for Sandusky; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 3:05AM EDT until June 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Wood and Sandusky Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Portage River At Woodville. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river inundates lower portions of Trail Marker Park and is out of banks in Pemberville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EDT Wednesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 3.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 12/12/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 800 AM EDT.
